name: Release Time Calibration Demo
description: Demonstrates the importance of proper release time calibration. Some instruments cut off too abruptly (short release), others sustain too long and blur together.

tracks.name: Vibraphone - Natural Resonance
tracks._comment: Release time: 1.0s. Real vibraphones ring for 2-4 seconds. Listen for natural decay.

tracks.name: Piano - Damper Pedal Effect
tracks._comment: Release time: 0.5s. Fast passages should have clear note separation.

tracks.name: Rhodes EP - Tine Decay
tracks._comment: Release time: 0.8s. Rhodes tines have distinctive bell-like decay character.

tracks.name: 808 Kick - Tight Decay
tracks._comment: Release time: 0.1s. 808 kicks need tight control to prevent muddy low end.

tracks.name: Hi-Hat Closed - Crisp Cutoff
tracks._comment: Release time: 0.05s. Closed hi-hats should cut off very quickly for tight rhythm.

tracks.name: Strings - Long Sustain
tracks._comment: Release time: 1.5s. Strings naturally sustain long with bow. Listen for smooth transitions.

listenFor: Vibraphone: Does the decay feel natural like metal bars ringing?
Piano: Are fast passages clear or do notes blur together?
Rhodes EP: Does the bell-like quality sustain appropriately?
808 Kick: Is the low end tight or does it get muddy?
Hi-Hat: Does it cut off crisply between hits?
Strings: Do sustained notes transition smoothly?
